Package frc.gpws

Class SoundManager

java.lang.Object
frc.gpws.SoundManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SoundManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
Literally everything here is serverside. For clientside audio support, please refer to Chirp.

Everything here is ServerSide

See Also:
Alarms, Sound

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  SoundManager.SoundPacks
    If you want different people to say different things, add that here and then add a new file in the runtime dir of the server inside a folder named <enumname>pack
    static class  SoundManager.Sounds
    All the words that the DS can say.

  • Method Details

    • enqueueSound

      public static void enqueueSound​(Sound sound)
      Adds a message to the queue.
      Parameters:
      sound - the sound to add to the queue

    • resetAudioStream

      public static void resetAudioStream​(Sound soundToPlay)
      By "reset" we just mean to go to the start of the input and play it
      Parameters:
      soundToPlay - the sound to play

    • stop

      public static void stop()
      Stops playing and sets position to 0

    • resolveAllAlarms

      public static void resolveAllAlarms()
      Unsets all alarm flags

    • init

      public static void init()

    • update

      public static void update()
      Heavy lifting funtion. Determines what alarms should sound, when, and when to deliver messages.

    • getClipWrapped

      private static javax.sound.sampled.Clip getClipWrapped()
      Dont mind this
      Returns:
      AudioSystem.getClip()

    • playAlarm

      private static boolean playAlarm()
      If there is no message being broadcast, plays most applicable alarm, otherwise does nothing.
      Returns:
      true if playing an alarm, false otherwise

    • run

      public void run()
      DO NOT RUN MORE THAN ONE SERVERSIDE THREAD UNLESS THE TWO THREADS DO NOT INTERACT!!! We need to be able to create a new thread to prevent the program from closing, but other than that, there is no other need. use this method when testing the sound manager on the server. Otherwise please refer to ClientServerPipeline.run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
